title: Standard Form of Hyperbola
text: The standard form for hyperbola is either $$\frac{{\left(x-h\right)}^2}{a^2}-\frac{{\left(y-k\right)}^2}{b^2}=1$$\nor $$\frac{{\left(y-k\right)}^2}{a^2}-\frac{{\left(x-h\right)}^2}{b^2}=1$$ depending on the transverse axis.
speech: The standard form for hyperbola is either  fraction, parentheses x minus h,  squared, over, a squared,  minus fraction, parentheses y minus k,  squared, over, b squared,  is equal to 1 \nor  fraction, parentheses y minus k,  squared, over, a squared,  minus fraction, parentheses x minus h,  squared, over, b squared,  is equal to 1  depending on the transverse axis.
pacedSpeech: The standard form for hyperbola is either   fraction,  x minus h,  squared, over, a squared,  minus fraction,  y minus k,  squared, over, b squared,  is equal to 1
or   fraction,  y minus k,  squared, over, a squared,  minus fraction,  x minus h,  squared, over, b squared,  is equal to 1

title: Parabola
text: Observe that only one of the variables, $$y$$, is of degree $$2$$, while $$x$$ is of degree $$1$$. Thus, this is a parabola.
speech: Observe that only one of the variables, , y , is of degree  2 , while  x  is of degree  1 . Thus, this is a parabola.
